title: I have received a phone call today for a delinquent student loan for marinello school of beauty should i pay this loan?
question: I live in California and went to Marinello school of beauty around 2012. I have a federal loan i am paying through the dept of education separate from this new creditor. Aside from the the federal loan i have been paying for about a year now i have not made any payments towards any school loans. The creditor i have talked to has brought up going to court.
answers: It sounds like maybe the school is trying to collect on a debt that is different than your federal student loans, such as maybe for books, housing, or something else at the school. If true, it is probably a dischargeable debt (unlike your federal loans). If it is dischargeable, whether you are obligated to pay depends on when/if the statute of limitations has run. I suggest you run the details by an Avvo consumer protection attorney -- most of us do not charge for our services.

The general rule is student loans are not dischargeable in bankruptcy, but there are exceptions. I agree you need to have a student loan expert review your paperwork. I recommend Avvo lawyer D.J. Rausa.

You state that you have been making payments on the Marinello debt. The Statute of Limitations (SoL) for a written contract in CA is 4 years from the date of your last payment. Perhaps you lost your SOL defense on an 8 year old debt because of that. Sorry I can't give you better news. To get another opinion, find/consult/hire a lawyer in your area using the Avvo feature "Find a Lawyer". Make a list of 4-5 having many 5 star reviews from satisfied clients. If you don't get a prompt call back from one, go on to the next on your list. Some offer a free consultation by phone or in person. Take us up on it. Good luck & God bless.
depending on the nature of the student loan it may be dischargeable and the statue of limitations may have also run. Take what paperwork you have to an experienced bankruptcy lawyer for review.
